strings.Value: "Tell me about yourself, please."
"A crime has taken place nearby. The one responsible may be hiding in this house. Have you seen anything suspicious?"
"I'll come back to you later."
"Far from Brevoy, are you not?"
"Do you prefer snares? Or a bow?"
"What kind of prey do you hunt?"
"An odd place to rest for the night."
"The woman in the kitchen — your cook?"
"Have you seen anyone suspicious?"
"Do you know the hostess of this lodge?"
"Do you recall who came to the lodge in the last hour or so?"
"I've been to your room. I found no hunting weapons there."
"I need a key to your room."
"A legalist? So you are a judge?"
"Oh, yes! Of course, Kabron Tedrim! I've heard about you and your famous legal cases!"
"Let's go back to other questions."
"Well, with a difficult job like yours it's impossible to get by without some divine support. Whom do you address your prayers to?"
"Let's go back to other questions."
"You've recognized me at once. Do I know you?"
"Well, I hope you enjoy your hunting. Let's change the topic."
{n}A bearded, middle-aged man stands before you. He wears a massive gold chain on his neck. The woman beside him gives a polite smile and a nod as you approach.{/n}

"Greetings, {mf|baron|baroness}". {n}The man's voice is so low as to rumble.{/n} "Let me introduce myself — Kabron Tedrim, from {g|Restov}Restov{/g}." {n}He nods to the woman beside him.{/n} "And this is my wife, Una Tedrim. We've come to your lands to hunt — yet, I admit, we did not expect to meet you in person. To what do we owe this honor?"
{n}Kabron Tedrim lowers his head.{/n} "Your Grace?"

"I'm a legalist, {mf|baron|baroness}." {n}Kabron hooks his thumbs into his embroidered belt. {/n} "My job is to ensure {g|Restov}Restov's{/g} laws are upheld. My wife is a keeper of the hearth and my loyal companion in prolonged journeys."
{n}Una nods without a word, her gaze fixed on you.{/n}

"You see, erm..." {n}Kabron clears his throat.{/n} "I've heard the wildlife here are excellent sport. So I decided to see for myself — sort truth from rumor, you understand. Fortunately, my fair wife was in favor of the trip — so here we are."
"Erm… a bow."

{n}Kabron freezes.{/n} "I..." {n}He swallows.{/n} "Cougars." {n}He swallows again, as if fighting to take a breath.{/n} "Magnificent predators. Worthy prey. For a worthy hunter." {n}He gives an awkward smile. {/n}

"Why, {mf|baron|baroness}!" {n}Una gives a false smile.{/n} "We adore this… charming dwelling!" {n}She glances around the dim hall — her smile remains, but you notice she raises an eyebrow at her surroundings, as if in judgment.{/n}
{n}Kabron nods quickly.{/n} "Yes! We… We just can't imagine our lives without Tsanna."
{n}Una coughs delicately.{/n} "My constitution demands a... unique diet." {n}She studies you closely.{/n} "A private matter, if you don't mind."
{n}The Tedrims exchange glances.{/n} "I'm afraid, Your Grace," {n}Kabron looks downcast.{/n} "We won't be able to help you."
{n}Despite Una's cool expression, you notice a bead of sweat running down her temple. As she spots your glance, her lips tighten. {/n}
{n}Kabron becomes white as a sheet.{/n} "Erm… you see… well..." {n}He licks his lips, which are now trembling slightly.{/n}
{n}You barely hear Una's hiss. {/n} "Get a hold of yourself, you fool. You'll ruin everything." {n}These words seem to have the desired effect — Kabron suddenly straightens and smiles.{/n}
{n}His wife's gentle support have had an almost enchanting effect on Kabron — he suddenly straightens and smiles as if nothing happened.{/n}

"Truth be told, it's a rather embarrassing matter..." {n}Kabron gives a hollow chuckle.{/n} "I proved a much worse hunter than I thought. Just imagine — I managed to snap not one, not two, but three bow-strings in a day! Infuriated, I broke my bow across my knee! It shames me to even speak of it..."
{n}Una smiles gently and looks aside.{/n}

{n}Kabron Tedrim freezes as if someone put a knife to his throat.{/n} "Is... is that so?" {n}He tries to smile, but his eyes are fearful. {/n} "I d-doubt, {mf|baron|baroness}, that anything you heard concerned me... my family name is a common one... I've so many relatives, I know not a quarter of them..." {n}He clears his throat.{/n}
{n}Kabron raises an eyebrow.{/n} "I doubt it, Your Grace, My legal cases are not so famous to be known outside {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g}."

{n}Kabron smiles slightly. {/n} "Not exactly. I work as a legal defendant in cases when a suspect's innocence must be proven. And, I admit, I have moderate success in this field..." {n}Kabron seems about to elaborate, then stops.{/n} "No need to bother you with tedious tales from the courts."
"Why, to Abadar, of course! Divine patron of law and lawyers!" {n}Kabron looks at you intently.{/n} "Surely, you are aware of {g|Abadar}Abadar{/g}, are you not? You must be! No matter, no matter."
"As you wish, Your Grace."

{n}Kabron looks around the hall.{/n} "We are not accustomed to such company, {mf|baron|baroness}. Besides, from the {g|Restov}Restov{/g} legalist's point of view, every person in this room is suspicious."
"No, I don't." {n}Kabron rubs his brow.{/n} "And I must say, she doesn't look forward to meeting new people either."

{n}Kabron casts a look behind you.{/n} "On second thought… this young woman… I didn't notice exactly when she entered the room." He turns to his wife. "My dear, perhaps you recall? What was the name our hostess used addressing her?"
"Olika, sweetheart." {n}Una shrugs faintly.{/n} "I cannot recall if I saw her at the start of the evening."
{n}Kabron nods.{/n}
{n}Una Tedrim raises her head.{/n} "We've decided a trip was in order. My husband worked long hours during the last several months, so he felt a journey would be good for us."

"I doubt it. But news about developments within the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} — and your role in them — has traveled far. {name} — is a well-known name beyond your borders." {n}Kabron gives a polite half-bow.{/n}
{n}Kabron takes a key from his purse and hands it to you.{/n} "As you wish, {mf|baron|baroness}."
{n}Una, who was watching her husband closely, touches his shoulder lightly.{/n} "I beg your pardon, {mf|baron|baroness}." {n}She leans in to Kabron and whispers something in his ear.{/n}
"My pleasure."
